intro: Hedyotis hedyotidea, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats on the ground. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are slender and often hairy. Hedyotis hedyotidea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
